metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14749 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
JerryScript 1.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (jmem_heap_alloc_block_internal heap memory corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted .js file, because unrecognized \ characters cause incorrect 0x00 characters in bytecode.literal data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-14749` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

iotjs - 1.0+715-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: iotjs package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0+715-1ubuntu1').
